column4: i want to run W7 for an online game I have and run Ubuntu for evertythiung else.  Whatrs best way to install?  W7 first or install Ubuntu first?  and can I run W732bit and Ubuntu 64bit on the same laptop?
usually you have to install Windows first or else it clobbers the bootloader. And there's no reason not to run the different arch versions.
architecture versions of operating systems. x86 x64
but I want to run ubuntu 64 bit.. but my W7 is 32 bit.. Can I dual boot them?
if you use the alternate install disc you can set up an encrypted volume
if I dont grab the alternative CD, then someone can get my data on Ubuntu?
Ubuntu doesn't know or care about drive letters. You'll need to make a new *partition* by shrinking the Windows one.
you can still do that but it will overwrite ubuntu.
you should probably start referring to those drives by their numbers instead
the letters are a Windows specific thing
i dont know what the letters are for C: and D: and E: etc?
the numbers are usually 1 for recovery and 2 for Windows
depending on how you partition, Ubuntu will be on partition 3 or 5
so C: = sda1?  And D: = sda2? e: = sda3
it *really* depends on the order that the partitions appear on the disk, so all I can say is "probably"
think of partitions as really enormous files. they are in a particular order. so we give them numbers.
